expect the unexpected|gpt-5-nano|1.1-idi.joke: I live by 'expect the unexpected'—which is why my coffee machine just launched into a TED Talk about my procrastination.
expect the unexpected|gpt-5-nano|1.1-idi.transformation: Phonetic and semantic reinforcement: preserves the idiom's cadence while reinterpreting 'the unexpected' as a modern, tangible agent (a coffee machine giving a TED Talk).
mechanisms: Semantic reinforcement (embodiment of the unexpected as a device)
expect the unexpected|gpt-5-nano|1.1-idi.explanation: The joke keeps the idiom recognizable but delivers a fresh, vivid twist by personifying a mundane kitchen appliance as a TED Talk speaker, delivering the 'unexpected' as a concrete, humorous scene.

pay for (someone)|gpt-5-nano|1.1-idiom.joke: I’m the guy who always pays for people—my wallet’s a charity, and tonight it filed for bankruptcy.
pay for (someone)|gpt-5-nano|1.1-idiom.transformation: A boastful setup about generosity is twisted into a vivid, embarrassing financial image, flipping the positive act into a humorous consequence.
pay for (someone)|gpt-5-nano|1.1-idiom.explanation: The joke keeps the spirit of paying for others but lands with a concrete, self-deprecating image (wallet bankrupt) that undercuts the brag in a surprising way.

affable personality|gpt-5-nano|1.1-idiom.joke: People say I’ve got an affable personality—polite, pleasant, perfectly performative—until I volunteered for a team headshot and walked out with cake on my head.
affable personality|gpt-5-nano|1.1-idiom.transformation: Turned the calm, friendly vibe into a brag that backfires into a vivid, embarrassing moment—the cake-on-head gag that undercuts the boast.
affable personality|gpt-5-nano|1.1-idiom.explanation: The joke preserves the familiar idea of an affable personality but pivots to an embarrassing, memorable moment. Alliteration reinforces the cadence of the boast, while the cake-on-head image provides a clear, humorous visual payoff.

cutting teeth|gpt-5-nano|1.1-idiom.joke: I'm cutting teeth in the startup world—turns out I'm just gnawing through the pitch deck with braces.
cutting teeth|gpt-5-nano|1.1-idiom.transformation: Brag-Setup → Humiliating Reveal; leverages dental imagery to subvert the idea of sharp progress into a concrete, funny struggle.
cutting teeth|gpt-5-nano|1.1-idiom.explanation: Keeps the idiom recognizable but pivots to a vivid, relatable image of struggling through a pitch deck; the dental motif reinforces 'teeth' while the self-deprecating twist lands the joke with a concrete, modern context.

expect the unexpected|gpt-5|1.1-idiom.joke: Expect the unex—text from your ex at 2:06 a.m.
expect the unexpected|gpt-5|1.1-idiom.transformation: Truncate 'unexpected' at 'unex' and pivot to a modern, specific twist ('text from your ex') that mirrors the idiom’s cadence.
expect the unexpected|gpt-5|1.1-idiom.explanation: You expect the completion 'unexpected' but get a pivot at 'unex' to a relatable late-night ex-text; the familiar cadence stays while the meaning swerves, creating a sharp modern surprise.

expect the unexpected|anthropic/claude-3.one_liner: Expect the unexpected, then pack an extra pair of pants just in case
expect the unexpected|anthropic/claude-3.explanation: The line maintains the wisdom of the original idiom while undercutting it with a specific, relatable image of over-preparation due to anxiety. The concrete detail of 'extra pair of pants' implies embarrassing accidents, creating a humorous contrast with the philosophical tone of the first half. The 'just in case' adds timing and makes it feel more conversational.
